News.Title: SEBI Bans Nirman Agri Genetics From Securities Market Over 93% IPO Fund Diversion
News.Summary: SEBI has banned SME-listed Nirman Agri Genetics Ltd. from accessing the securities market following alleged diversion of IPO funds. The company raised Rs 20.30 crore through its IPO in March 2023 with First Overseas Capital Ltd. as lead manager. SEBI's investigation found the company mis-utilized approximately Rs 18.89 crore or 93% of IPO proceeds by transferring funds to entities that were either fictitious or controlled by promoter Pranav Kailas Bagal and his relatives. The regulator has also halted all proposed corporate actions including bonus issues, stock splits, and name change to Agriicare Life Corp Ltd. The investigation revealed that Nirman Agri diverted Rs 6.75 crore through multiple layers to promoter-linked entities and claimed to have paid Rs 12.14 crore to four vendors with suspect credentials without providing invoices. NSE site visits confirmed these entities were non-existent at given addresses with no agricultural activities found. The promoter group's shareholding has declined from 65.59% at listing to 44.33% as of September, with Bagal selling 8.6 lakh shares representing 10.71% of his holding during September.

News.Title: Nirman Agri Genetics Board to Consider 1:10 Stock Split and Bonus Shares on September 30
News.Summary: Nirman Agri Genetics board will meet on September 30, 2025 to consider a 1:10 stock split and 1:10 bonus share proposal. The stock split aims to make shares more affordable and increase liquidity, while the bonus issue is intended to reward existing shareholders. The board will also discuss strategic expansion into hydroponics and aquaponics farming technologies to capitalize on demand for sustainable agricultural methods. The company's shares closed at Rs 172.45 on NSE, up 5% for the day. Nirman Agri Genetics is an agri-input company producing hybrid seeds, pesticides, and bio-organic products with a market capitalization of Rs 138.13 crore. The stock has declined 59% over the past year but gained 19% in the last month.

News.Title: Nirman Agri Genetics Receives Trademark Certificate for Krushidham Project
News.Summary: Nirman Agri Genetics has announced that the government has granted them a certificate of trademark. This trademark will enable the company to initiate their Krushidham project, which is likely a new agricultural initiative.

News.Title: Nirman Agri Genetics Receives Trademark Certificate for Krushidham Project
News.Summary: Nirman Agri Genetics has announced that the government has granted them a certificate of trademark. This trademark will enable the company to proceed with their Krushidham project, potentially expanding their agricultural initiatives.

News.Title: Nirma: Massive Net Loss of Rs 2,623.01 Crore in Q2 FY2025
News.Summary: Nirma reported a net loss of Rs 2,623.01 crore in Q2 FY2025, compared to a net profit of Rs 123.18 crore in Q2 FY2024. Sales marginally declined by 0.05% to Rs 1,742.26 crore. Operating Profit Margin improved to 16.34% from 13.72% year-on-year.

News.Title: U.S. Durable Goods Orders Remain Unchanged in August
News.Summary: The final report for U.S. durable goods orders in August shows no change (0.0%) from the previous month, matching both the initial estimate and market expectations.

News.Title: U.S. ISM Non-Manufacturing Prices Rise in September
News.Summary: The U.S. Institute for Supply Management's (ISM) Non-Manufacturing Prices Index for September increased to 59.4, surpassing both the previous month's reading of 57.3 and the estimated forecast of 56.3. This indicates a faster rate of price increases in the services sector.

News.Title: U.S. ISM Non-Manufacturing PMI Exceeds Expectations in September
News.Summary: The U.S. Institute for Supply Management's Non-Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) for September 2023 came in at 54.9, significantly higher than the previous month's 51.5 and beating the estimated 51.7. This indicates stronger-than-expected growth in the U.S. services sector.

News.Title: U.S. Factory Orders Decline in August
News.Summary: U.S. factory orders for August decreased by 0.2% month-over-month, falling short of the estimated 0.1% increase. This represents a significant drop from the previous month's 5.0% growth.

News.Title: U.S. Services PMI Slightly Declines in September
News.Summary: The U.S. Services Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) for September came in at 55.2, showing a slight decrease from the previous month's 55.4. The actual figure was marginally lower than the estimated 55.4.

News.Title: U.S. Continuing Jobless Claims Decrease Slightly
News.Summary: The latest U.S. continuing jobless claims data shows a decrease to 1,826,000 from the previous 1,834,000. This figure is lower than the estimated 1,830,000, indicating a slight improvement in the job market.

News.Title: U.S. Initial Jobless Claims Rise Slightly
News.Summary: The latest U.S. initial jobless claims data shows a slight increase to 225,000, up from the previous week's 218,000. This figure is higher than the estimated 221,000 claims.
